channel.title: Comments on: Alexandra DeWitt, Fridging, and “Disposable” Female Characters
channel.description: Stellar Short Fiction by Women-Identified Writers Since 2010

item.title: By: Andrew
item.dc:creator: Andrew
item.description: Nicely summarized. Links to tvtropes for the two modern tropes you mention would be nice. The mannequin incident is arguable, as it's not a fridging, but rather a deliberate reference to it to mess with the character by triggering his PTSD. While the fridging was sloppy writing, and brutally unnecessary, a villain making use of a past event is standard fare. I notice you didn't mention Sue Dibny here - will she be in a future Opening the Fridge?
